title: [C++ API] Remove detail.{h,cpp}
body_html:
In autogradpp, detail.{h,cpp} was kind of a bag of different typedefs and utility types and functions. I've remove these or split them up into separate files, including changing some of the function names to match the Python API.

Some things:

  • Moved no_grad_guard and setSeed into util.{h,cpp}, and renamed setSeed to manual_seed (like in PyTorch)
  • Moved hasCuda and hasCudnn into cuda.{h,cpp} and renamed to torch::cuda::is_available() and torch::cuda::cudnn_is_available()
  • Removed variable_list typedef in favor of vector<Variable>. This is OK because at one point we'll change all modules to have better forward() methods, since the virtual forward with the variable_list signature is now removed.

@ebetica

body:
In autogradpp, `detail.{h,cpp}` was kind of a bag of different typedefs and utility types and functions. I've remove these or split them up into separate files, including changing some of the function names to match the Python API.

Some things:
- Moved `no_grad_guard` and `setSeed` into `util.{h,cpp}`, and renamed `setSeed` to `manual_seed` (like in PyTorch)
- Moved `hasCuda` and `hasCudnn` into `cuda.{h,cpp}` and renamed to `torch::cuda::is_available()` and `torch::cuda::cudnn_is_available()`
- Removed `variable_list` typedef in favor of `vector<Variable>`. This is OK because at one point we'll change all modules to have better `forward()` methods, since the virtual `forward` with the `variable_list` signature is now removed.

@ebetica
